page.title: 02OLD TIMERS 1
page.content: Gwaelod-y-Garth is a small village perched on a hill, overlooking TAFFS WELL. The community seems to be split into two very distinct factions. The old people who have have lived in the village all of their lives, and the smart young set, with large cars... and even larger bank accounts! The feeling amongst the older residents is that these young 'professional' people care more about property values than they do about community life. Contact between the two groups is almost non existant, and his leads to no small amount of distrust. Some of the young people do make the effort to join in, but the number is nowhere near enough.
